paper_title: Physically Consistent Multiple-Step Data-Driven Predictions Using Physics-based Filters
abstract: (Extended Version) Data-driven control can facilitate the rapid development of controllers, offering an alternative to conventional approaches. In order to maintain consistency between any known underlying physical laws and a data-driven decision-making process, preprocessing of raw data is necessary to account for measurement noise and any inconsistencies it may introduce. In this paper, we present a physics-based filter to achieve this and demonstrate its effectiveness through practical applications, using real-world datasets collected in a building on the Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne (EPFL) campus. Two distinct use cases are explored: indoor temperature control and demand response bidding.
